Overview

Navigator games, a studio based in Vancouver B.C. they work directly with Iron Maiden band to develop Iron Maiden Legacy of the Beast game. The game is the #1 rated mobile RPG with high rating (4.7/5) in Google Play and Apple App Store. After the game grow players star to complain about finding information of what they need. Since the genre of the game is strategy , provide information is crucial for users. Also the size of compnay is not big so have to make the site intuitive to maintance. To solve those problem decide to use WordPress. Company already use the WordPress site for Newsfeed but that is not cusomtized bashboard so it was hard to maintance if you are not familiar of using some code or structure.

Role

Research, UI/UX Design, Graphic Design, Front-end Development

Tools

Design: Photoshop, Invision Development: WordPress (PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, AWS S3, etc.)

Goal & Challenge

​The Compendium initiative goals are easy access and search while players are playing the game and easy to maintance.

The biggest challenge was I have to consider two different users, visitors (players) and users (game designer).

Proposal solutions

For players
  • High performance
    • Limited images and use text with HTML
    • Fast page load time
  • Clarity & readability
    • ​Easy to follow and easy to understand even though its long content
  • Accessible depth
    • Easy to access each screen
    • Easy search item they are looking for
    • Accessibility (link pages together by icons, so the players don’t have to go back and forth to see the detail of character and abilities)
For in-house maintenance side users
  • Make it automatic system
    • Game designer organize the file with Excel. By using Excel let them just upload the file in the Wordpress and it upload itself.
  • Easy to maintanince
    • Anyone can learn
    • Organize the content by categories so it's easy to find content and edit content

Design Research

Researched competitor’s games to find out now a day's trendy design for layout, and what kind of layout users prefers (Downloaded competitor’s games, and find their wiki website). Created a deck to wrote down the pros/cons of the website and what kind of thing we can implement in our project. On the side, I started to create SWOT Analysis of RPG games for future projects.

Research Deck

SWOT Analysis

Wireframe

Once I had a solid design direction, I began to produce high & low fidelity mockups, which would then be converted into prototypes with limited functionalities. Used Invision to do flow test and functionality test with the team.

Mobile First

The entire page was mainly designed mobile-first (horizontal size) because the site needed to be loaded inside of the game.

USER INTERFACE

The game has its own color scheme, so I did not have many options to choose the color. I tried to balance out the colors with items and images on the page.

Flow Chart

​Link all pages on Invision, so the team can test its functionality before building the site with WordPress. Worked closely with game designers to improve screen flow.

Final work

​​Worked closely with game designers to update the layout based on the new content.

Building structure in WordPress

The site is built by WordPress. The company wants to use a WordPress site because it’s faster than developing the site with plain HTML. To increase loading speed, I used 1-2 plugins and wrote some PHP code.

I found out game designer use excel to organzie the game items so I was thinking how can I make it easy to implement the data and avoid repeatly work (copy and paost) I have experiences with building customize Wordpress site for the clients so I decide to use Excel file uploader so once the game designer upload the excel file. All the data upload automatically and generate the pages it needs. I suggested to convert Excel file to CSV file and upload as JSON data source for WordPress. However, because of time restrictions, we decide to use the CSV importer plugin to WordPress.

CSV Uploader

The site is built by WordPress. The company wants to use a WordPress site because it’s faster than developing the site with plain HTML. To increase loading speed, I used 1-2 plugins and wrote some PHP code.

I found out game designer use excel to organzie the game items so I was thinking how can I make it easy to implement the data and avoid repeatly work (copy and paost) I have experiences with building customize Wordpress site for the clients so I decide to use Excel file uploader so once the game designer upload the excel file. All the data upload automatically and generate the pages it needs. I suggested to convert Excel file to CSV file and upload as JSON data source for WordPress. However, because of time restrictions, we decide to use the CSV importer plugin to WordPress.

CONTINUED OPTIMIZATION & MAINTENANCE WORK

​​Kept tracking users behavior via Google Analytics. Our team does a monthly meeting to discuss results and what are the things we can improve in the next update.
